zone.line: but observe Posterity has done
ample justice to the great names
now
here cited referred to. Their errors
have been weighed & have been
found as dust in the balance,
if their sins were as scarlet they
are now as white as snow: they
have been washed in the blood of
the
the mediator & redeemer Time.
Observe in what a luducrous
chaos the imputations of real & of
fictitious crime have been confused
in the contemporary calumnies against
poetry & poets; consider how little
is as it appears, or appears as it
is; look to your own hearts motives
and judge not, lest ye be judged.
There is a certain plausibility in
every great mor enoremous opinion
that has gained any degree of
